jobDescription:
Lookout, Inc. is the endpoint to cloud security company purpose-built for the intersection of enterprise and personal data. We safeguard data across devices, apps, networks and clouds through our unified, cloud-native security platform — a solution that's as fluid and flexible as the modern digital world. By giving organizations and individuals greater control over their data, we enable them to unleash its value and thrive. Lookout is trusted by enterprises of all sizes, government agencies and millions of consumers to protect sensitive data, enabling them to live, work and connect — freely and safely. To learn more about the Lookout Cloud Security Platform, visit www.lookout.com and follow Lookout on our blog , LinkedIn and Twitter .
We’re looking for a high-energy, creative, detail-oriented and passionate person to join the Sales organization at Lookout. You will be responsible for managing and creating multiple aspects of our relationship with customers. Successful candidates will be results-oriented, self-directed and have a strategic orientation balanced with a strong ability to contribute directly to the businesses we build with our customers. You have solid contacts within the technical community. You are an experienced engineer with a successful track record of solving difficult technical issues, architecting a solution to meet customer needs, and provide valuable feedback to developers based on customer input. You know how to ensure that your customer's needs and wants are conveyed across the organization, while primarily safeguarding the interests of your own company.
Responsibilities
Forecast and deliver upon the revenue plan associated with your named accountsCreate deep ongoing relationships at multiple levels of the organization, you will represent their interests well internally, most importantly balancing Lookout’s interests within that of the customerManage investments to improve win probabilityPosition the capabilities of Lookout Security products with the customer to define RFP requirementsAid in the response to RFIs and RFPs in a timely and professional manner to win bidsCommunicate customer requirements and competitive data, including feature needs, and value proposition to the product and marketing teams and senior managementProvide input to senior management on go-to-market strategiesBuild the Lookout Security brand by presenting at seminars and conferences.


Requirements
A solid system/sales engineer with excellent relevant experience, strong ties with customers and an extremely positive reputation for delivery10+ years of direct sales engineering experience with customersExcellent presentation and communication skills and the ability to boil down complex topics into clear and easily understandable messagesThe ability to help the company become a thought leader in the Mobile spaceThe ability to sit on technical panels and deliver strong technical presentations to prospective customersDemonstrated ability to develop effective programs, optimize efforts and communicate resultsStrong interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to influence and drive others. Be able to say “no”, take charge of the account, manage all interactions with that accountFlawless organizational and follow up skillsExcellent analytical skills

jobDescription:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.
JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)LOCATION: Remote - Canada Only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Partial overlap)HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $80 – $120/hrESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short term

THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements
 Project will involve building and deploying a Laravel GraphQL Database that will serve as the backend for both a customer facing booking app and operator facing management app Experience with python serverless function is a plus- you will likely not be building those but will need to use them as that is where our client's ML code lives Experience both building backend applications and working with data is a plus ML experience is not required but a major plus

What you’ll be working on

You will be working on a very small startup team building AI powered applications for aviation booking and fleet management. Your role will be essential in drawing together flight optimization algorithms and customs LLMs into a graphql AP

Apply Now!

companyDescription:
Braintrust is the first decentralized Web3 talent network that connects skilled, vetted knowledge workers with the world’s leading companies. The community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it, ensuring the network always serves the needs of its users, instead of a centrally-controlled corporation. And because the community of knowledge workers and contributors earns ownership and control of Braintrust through its native BTRST token for their contributions to the network and its growth, new Talent and jobs have participated in the network at record speeds. 

Braintrust has over 700,000+ community members, with knowledge workers and project contributors across the world. Braintrust is trusted by hundreds of Fortune 1000 global enterprises including Nestlé, Porsche, Atlassian, Goldman Sachs, and Nike. For more information, visit: www.braintrust.com.

BTRST is available on Coinbase.com and in the Coinbase Android and iOS apps. Coinbase customers can trade, send, receive, or store BTRST in most Coinbase-supported regions. For more information on Braintrust and the BTRST token, read the “Braintrust: The Decentralized Talent Network” whitepaper.

jobDescription:
Detailed Job Description
Envision yourself in a role where you can make a big impact working and collaborating with a group of enthusiastic, like-minded individuals with a focus on the energy transition including carbon capture, utilization, and storage (CCUS), hydrogen, bioenergy, electrification (of compression and power) and other low carbon energy solutions.
Our Energy Transition (ETX) team requires a creative and robust Project Engineer that will develop, detail and finalize the balance of plant technical design, including overseeing most design and engineering related activities for FEL-0, 1, & 2 studies. This information shall be developed in the form of application specific design basis, process flow diagrams, process and instrumentation diagrams, plot plans, general arrangement drawings, structural drawings, electrical drawings, data sheets, equipment lists, electrical load lists, process and control narratives, and overall plant estimates. This work, along with any other required data, must be accomplished whilst complying with the company standards, company contractual obligations, the project proposal, and the customers’ specifications or input.
Reporting to the Manager, Applications & Proposals for ETX, the Project Engineer will lead the Balance of Plant (BoP) engineering in performing all tasks required to support the completion of the engineering studies for a turnkey facility. I.e. CCUS Capture Facility, Bioenergy/Biofuels facility, BoP modules for hydrogen facilities, etc.
With a foundation of integrity, the successful candidate will use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. This position could be based out of our Calgary, Alberta or Houston, Texas office. Other regions and remote work may also be considered.
Principle Responsibilities and Duties: 
Interface with the inhouse regional Engineered Systems teams, the Balance of Plant Engineering sub- contractor and our Customers:
After engineering study award, liaison with the Project Development or Process Lead Engineer to hand over all data used for conceptual design and estimating and understand the background and particulars associated with the project.Identify the customer’s requirements (technical/products problems, execution issues) and bring effective solutions.Coordinate technical issues with the process and E&IC engineers and customer (technical clarification, answer technical comments, deviation requests) and reach consensus.Attend certain internal and external meetings (kick off, coordination, HAZOP etc.)
Participate in internal/external design activities and technical decisions to support the engineering studies:
Develop the project P&ID’s and requisition Balance of Plant equipment as assigned and coordinate all other deliverables.Participate in all aspects of design review with the applications / engineering team.Ensure proper understanding of the Customer’s technical needs inside Enerflex and engineering team.Generate preliminary engineering Bill of Material for the assigned project items.Perform overall plant estimating activities including: packaged equipment; engineering and construction management; BoP Engineering; BoP pipe modules/racks, vessels, utilities and equipment, electrical and controls, valves and instrumentation; civil works, mechanical, structural and electrical contractor; commissioning and startup, as well as assist in proposal engineering hours estimates for engineering studies.
Own the planning of all engineering activities:
Prepare, manage and schedule engineering deliverables as required to complete the engineering studies and for submission to the customer.Follow up on technical issues throughout engineering study, as needed.Manage and control engineering hours allocated to the job.Monitor the progress of technology vendor and sub-contractor deliverables and drawings.
Support And Interface With Other Company Functions
Project Management: Report on engineering issues and progress for all assigned items.Design & Drafting: Coordinate and approve all design and drafting deliverables.Project Engineering: Technical interface with BoP suppliers to obtain quotations for all assigned items.Purchasing: Technical interface with buyers to confirm preferred vendors and long term supply agreements.Logistics: Technical interface with regional logistics teams as necessary to support overall engineering studies.
Qualifications: 
Completion of an Engineering (process, chemical or mechanical) or Engineering Technology degree is required. An equivalent combination of experience and education may be considered.Minimum of 5 years’ industry related experience in project engineering.Basic knowledge of the fundamentals required by the equipment used in our products:Mechanical DesignThermodynamicsChemistryInstrumentation & ControlsAbility to work on complex problems using strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills. Customer focused and a strong team player.Experience in process simulation software (i.e. Promax or HYSYS) and various vendor sizing tools.Proficient with MS Office especially MS word, excel, MS projects and other computer applications.Experience with Primavera scheduling software would be considered an asset.Fluency in English.Professional attitude.Travel to sites may be required.
Working Conditions 
Fast-paced general office environment with tasks that have high degrees of time sensitivity. Domestic and international travel may be required on occasion.
What Enerflex Offers You:
Values Based OrganizationCompetitive CompensationFlex timeEmployer Paid Health and Dental BenefitsEmployee Share Purchase ProgramEmployer Matched Pension ProgramSafety Focused CultureIncentive ProgramsProfessional Development OpportunitiesCollaborative in office work environment, supportive team membersWork/life flexibility
Enerflex is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Enerflex grants equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, genetic information, mental or physical disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. Equal employment opportunities are provided in recruitment, hiring, promotions, wages, benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment.
Disclaimer
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, tasks, duties, knowledge, skills, and abilities required.
Please visit our website at www.enerflex.com for more information.

jobDescription:
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Title: Software EngineerLocation: Montreal, QC / RemoteCommitment: Full-Time (1 year contract with possibility to extend)Compensation: Market CompetitiveApply By: March 10, 2023Start Date: ASAP
HOW TO APPLY:
To apply, please send an email to info@femtherapeutics.com. Please include the title of the position you are applying to in the subject line and attach your resume.
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in 2019 with headquarters in Montreal, QC, FemTherapeutics Inc. is a medical device company with a mission to personalize medicine for women. We have developed a data and intelligence platform that leverages AI, cloud software, and 3D printing to produce patient-specific gynecological prosthetics for the non-invasive treatment of pelvic health conditions. Our first product is indicated to manage the symptoms of Pelvic Organ Prolapse and Stress Urinary Incontinence.
As FemTherapeutics works towards market launch at the end of 2023, the team is currently looking for a motivated Software Engineer that is keen to learn, grow and build clinician/patient focused tech. We are looking for curious and analytical individuals with a strong data science background, a passion for applying artificial intelligence in the field of medicine, and a good understanding of deep learning models/tools.
This is an opportunity for a tech-savvy individual or entrepreneur to join a growing Montreal start-up working with cutting-edge technology to modernize treatments for women’s health. This is a remote-based role with the option of coming into the office in Montreal in a mixed work environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop new Machine Learning (ML) models, troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing ML models on patient data (including numerical and imaging data),Create the ML model wrappers, Application Programming Interface (API), and create the backend of the company’s software platform,Automate the data flow among the simulation software packages used by the company and connect them with the ML model’s outcome,Integrate the patient’s data into the company’s existing computer vision and deep learning models and maintain and upgrade existing models and algorithms.Data exploration and handling, characterizing the data and obtaining additional numerical and imaging data,Produce clean, efficient code based on specifications,Work closely with other developers, UI/UX designers, business and systems analysts and liaise with internal and external collaborators to design algorithms and flowcharts,Be creative and try innovative approaches to implement ML models and algorithms, Have the ability to learn new technologies quickly and have an analytical mind,Good communication skills – both written and verbal (French proficiency is considered an asset)
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: 
Must have a Masters in data science, computer science or software engineering with 2+ years of work experience building Machine Learning modelsExtensive experience in developing codes in Python (Pycharm/Jupyter) and Java (IntelliJIDEA) and developing ML algorithms using Pytorch and Tensorflow, AWS SageMaker,Experience analyzing big data and medical image datasets, preprocessing and annotation using OpenCV, CNN, ResNet, U-net, R-CNN, medical imaging software such as ImageJ and FIJI,Experience in Linux (UNIX) and managing databases and SQL and cloud computing, Google cloud data science platform and AWS,Extensive experience in designing, building, and deploying NLP models and frameworks such as NLTK, spaCy, or Gensim,Experienced in creating web-based, desktop and mobile applications on the front end and back end,Experience working with AI/ML models in biomedical and mechanical design optimization application.
ASSETS:
Experience working within an ISO:13485 or MDSAP environment considered an asset to log design history and operate under document controls.Have an understanding and interest in women's health and pelvic floor anatomy,Experience working with containers (such as Docker) is considered an asset
HIRING PROCESS:
If we interview you, you can expect these milestones. The entire process will take 2 weeks. You meet the hiring manager for the roleYou complete two calls with other team membersWe speak with two references you provideWe make an offer
BENEFITS:
All full-time employees enjoy:Health plan benefitsESOP participation100% remote position with the option to work in-person at FT's offices in downtown Montreal.
FemTherapeutics is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected.

Built to provide non-invasive solutions for pelvic health conditions, FemTherapeutics’ first product is indicated to manage the symptoms of Pelvic Organ Prolapse and Stress Urinary Incontinence.

jobDescription:

What's on Offer?
Great Opportunity

jobTitle: Joist- SDET- Software Development Engineer in Test - Remote (CAN)
jobDescription:
Software Development Engineer in Test, Joist– REMOTE (Canada)}

EverCommerce [Nasdaq: EVCM] is a leading service commerce platform, providing vertically tailored, integrated SaaS solutions that help more than 600,000 global service-based businesses accelerate growth, streamline operations, and increase retention. Our modern digital and mobile applications create predictable, informed, and convenient experiences between customers and their service professionals. Specializing in Home & Field Services, Health Services, and Fitness & Wellness industries, EverCommerce solutions include end-to-end business management software, embedded payment acceptance, marketing technology, and customer engagement applications.

We are building an extraordinary company and looking for talented, energetic, and motivated people to join our team. You can learn more about our Company, Culture and Values here: https://www.evercommerce.com/about-us/careers/

We are looking for a SDET to focus on our Joist product. Joist, an EverCommerce solution group, is an end to end vertical software platform for small & medium-sized trades contractors. We have a simple mission: Make Contractors Heroes. Joist provides web and mobile applications for small business contractors to estimate, invoice, record, and process payments, and manage projects from anywhere. From humble beginnings, we're now helping over 1 million contractors across North America, the UK, and Australia, making us one of the largest trades platform in the world and we have major growth planned!

You are someone who cares deeply about quality and providing the best possible customer experience. You derive satisfaction from automating processes and reducing toil for yourself and others. You will contribute to solutions from inception to deployment, and everything in between. The solutions you and your team build must not only work for Joist today, but also support rapid iteration and innovation as we grow. Your work is going to be nothing less than redefining the home renovation industry, and your tool belt is full of tools that assist with software delivery, testing, automation, and more.

Responsibilities

Providing a Testing Mindset You understand that quality is not owned by one person, but by the entire team. You are able to grow skills in quality control in the people around you and provide feedback on how to improve as a team.

Automation As an engineer, you know the power that automated processes can bring to help teams ship with confidence. You will lead efforts to build and contribute to various testing and release automation frameworks that enable our teams to move quickly.

Teamwork Many of the problems we encounter require insight from many parts of the business. Your ability to coordinate and communicate with your peers is essential to our success.

CS Fundamentals You have an understanding of algorithms, data structures, design patterns and data storage technologies. You are able to select the right tool for the right job.

Delivery Focused Code on a laptop doesn’t solve problems. You know that a project is only done once it's delivered and validated. Residential construction is a large problem to tackle. You are inspired to complete a project because you know that 5 more problems are waiting to be tackled, and you do it all without sacrificing quality.

Passion Hard problems are not solved overnight. It takes a special kind of attitude and hunger to disrupt an entrenched industry. Your passion is what you share with every teammate at Joist. Passion for technology, passion for working as a team, passion for change, and passion for building an industry revolutionizing product.

Skills And Experience Needed For Success In This Role
2-3 years of industry experience working as a SDET with agile product development teams.Hands on experience with modern testing tools and frameworks such as BrowserStack, Webdriver.io, Appium, Playwright, and others.Basic knowledge of and experience working with CI systems such as Jenkins, CircleCI, etc.Experience in performing detailed root cause analysis up and down the software stack using a variety of debugging tools.The ability to communicate clearly and concisely about deeply technical topics in an easy-to-understand way.You can deal with ambiguity and are experienced in helping to generate refined acceptance criteria for development work.
Bonus Qualities
You have worked at other small to mid-sized companies that went through periods of growth and team scalingExperience doing Accessibility testingExperience working with cloud microservice architecturesExperience with Infrastructure as Code for use in cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Heroku or GCPYou hold a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or in a similar field. While not a requirement, it helps to have a common baseline of understanding of CS principles when working with other technical people.
Where: Remote (Joist head office located in Toronto, Canada).

The EverCommerce team is distributed globally, with teams in the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Jordan, New Zealand, and Australia. With a widely distributed team, we are used to working remotely across different time zones. This role can be based anywhere in Canada – if you’re close to one of our offices, we can set you up in-office or you can work 100% remotely.

Benefits & Perks

Flexibility to work where/how you want within your country of employment – in-office, remote, or hybrid

Robust wellness benefits, including an annual wellness stipend

3 weeks of vacation to start, a paid volunteer day of your choosing, plus 2 floating holidays to celebrate anything of significance to you

Employee Stock Purchase Program

Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with 4% company match

Continued investment in your professional development through Udemy

EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience!

At Joist, we’re committed to helping contractors reach their full potential by looking more professional, managing their customer interaction, and getting paid fast and efficiently. Our mission has always been simple: we’re here to make contractors heroes!

Hundreds of thousands of users employ our powerful applications and tools to win more jobs, get time back in their day, and better serve their customers.

jobDescription:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, and web services at scale. We are building the next generation management solution for Ubuntu in the enterprise - on premise and on the public cloud - to enable large estate observability, telemetry, security, compliance and operations. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Landscape is the leading management tool to deploy, monitor and manage fleets of Ubuntu systems, including package and repository management, health and security monitoring, hardware inventory, and automation. As Landscape software engineer you will be responsible for contributing on a distributed development team participating in all facets of the development process.

What you'll do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed teamWrite high-quality code to create new features, fix bugs and modernize the Landscape codebaseDemonstrate your strong commitment to code quality and automated testingParticipate in the engineering process with code and architectural reviewsTake personal ownership of problems and design and deliver solutionsWork remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external eventsAssist with release management during each development cycleCollaborate with devops for Landscape SaaS, Canonical's hosted Landscape

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant peopleYou are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountableYou value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivatedYou have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degreeYou have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python. Experience with Python and web frameworks such as Flask and Django. Experience with databases, and ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus)You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. 

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

#stack
companyDescription:
We deliver open source to the world faster,  more securely and more cost effectively than any other company.

We develop Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means 'humanity to others'​. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation.

Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers.

Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why its the fastest growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

If you're interested in a career at Canonical, we are a remote-first company so please apply to any suitable role as skills are valued more than location, despite some having a preferred geographic preference. 

www.ubuntu.com

jobDescription:
Title: WordPress Developer (NOT designer) Location: PST/ESTlocations, Canada Reporting to: Vice President Operations, Adnet
Proactive is a global, multimedia organisation providing investor engagement services to hundreds of listed companies and pre-IPO businesses across the globe, 24/7. In November 2021, Proactive acquired Adnet, a leading developer and designer of corporate websites for public and private companies. Based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Adnet has delivered website solutions for over 25 years, and has over 450 clients. Its product set, which also includes service maintenance, search engine optimisation, graphic design, and cloud storage services, are an integral part of Proactive’s offering to Canadian companies. Due to the growth in the number of clients as well as our strategic plans in the near future, we are looking to appoint a developer to join our high-performing and close-knit team to work with the VP Operations who oversees and manages customer support and updates for our North American clients.  The ideal candidate is a responsible and independent team member, with excellent communication skills. She/he is a quick learner that can adapt to different situations. Reporting to the VP Operations, she/he will have experience developing web applications and WordPress websites. In exchange, she/he will have a career in a growing company with opportunities to advance. This is an exciting role at an exciting time for Adnet and Proactive

companyDescription:
Proactive enables companies and investors to connect intelligently. We are one of the fastest growing financial media portals in the world, providing breaking news, commentary and analysis on hundreds of listed companies and pre-IPO businesses across the globe, 24/7.

And, uniquely, our renowned multi-media business is complemented by quality events management, smart investor relations delivery and a highly respected research offering.

jobTitle: Ingénieur logiciel - responsable technique (DO-178) / Software Engineer Technical Lead (DO-178)
jobDescription:
Systèmes & Logiciels MANNARINO Inc. possède plus de 20 ans d'expérience dans la conception, le développement, la vérification et la certification de logiciels embarqués en temps réel pour des applications critiques en matière de sécurité, grâce à une combinaison unique de services et de produits COTS.
La base de clients de Systèmes & Logiciels MANNARINO Inc. est très large, couvrant les entreprises aérospatiales traditionnelles ainsi que des marchés nouveaux et passionnants, notamment la propulsion électrique, la mobilité aérienne urbaine, les véhicules aériens sans pilote et le vol autonome.
La culture de MANNARINO est axée sur la qualité, le travail, le professionnalisme et le travail d'équipe dans une atmosphère très respectueuse et motivante, axée sur la croissance à long terme de l'entreprise.En tant que membre de notre équipe, vous en bénéficierez :D’une gamme complète d’assurance collective et un plan RÉER collectif;D’une politique d’horaire flexible;D’une prime discrétionnaire ;Du remboursement des frais de conditionnement physique;D'autres avantages, tels que des dîners hebdomadaires par un traiteur de même que des boissons chaudes à volonté (expresso, café, chocolat chaud, thé);Des sorties régulières avec les membres de l’équipe.
Rôle/responsabilités du posteNous sommes à la recherche d'un ﻿Ingénieur logiciel - responsable technique (RT) pour diriger des équipes d'ingénierie logicielle soutenant des projets pour l'industrie aérospatiale. Le responsable technique communiquera étroitement avec le client et le gestionnaire de projet afin de livrer des projets qui répondent aux attentes du point de vue de la qualité, du calendrier et du budget.Le candidat doit avoir fait ses preuves en matière de gestion d'équipes pour réussir dans un environnement dynamique. Le RT sera un leader chevronné qui apporte une compréhension approfondie des projets et des pratiques de génie logiciel pour les applications critiques en matière de sécurité.

aux membres de l'équipe.Suivre l'activité et les performances des membres de l'équipe et leur fournir un soutien technique.Planifier et coordonner les activités des membres de l'équipe.Identifier les employés les plus performants et guider leur développement personnel et leur croissance.Interviewer, sélectionner et intégrer de nouveaux membres au sein de l'équipe.Soutien à la gestion de projetDiriger une équipe de génie logiciel selon les besoins, en veillant à ce que le client, les exigences de certification et le calendrier des produits livrables de l'équipe soient respectés et à ce que les coûts du projet soient gérés efficacement.Responsable et redevable de l'utilisation la plus efficace et la plus appropriée des ressources de l'équipe pour le projet assignéSoutenir les activités de planification et de rapport du chef de projetFournir des estimations réalistes et suivre régulièrement l'avancement du projetSoutenir les audits avec les clients et les autorités de certificationDéveloppement de logicielsResponsable de la conception, du développement, des tests et de la livraison de divers composants de développement logiciel.Participer à des réunions avec le client et à des sessions de conception pour identifier et finaliser le champ d'application.Évaluer les solutions et fournir des recommandations aux développeurs de logiciels.S'assurer que les principes d'architecture et de conception ainsi que les meilleures pratiques sont respectés lors de la conception et du développement des solutions.Développer des logiciels embarqués robustes, fiables, efficaces et testables.Développer la documentation du logiciel conformément aux exigences / directives de certification du projet.Soutenir l'effort de vérification du logiciel.Compétences requisesAu moins 7 à 10 ans d'expérience progressive dans un rôle de direction technique à la tête de projets/programmes de développement de logiciels critiques pour la sécurité.Une connaissance et une compréhension approfondies du génie logiciel dans l'aérospatiale commerciale sont requises.Expérience des normes de développement de logiciels telles que RTCA/DO-178C & 254﻿ est du travail.Solides compétences interpersonnellesSolides compétences en matière de présentationExcellentes compétences en matière de planification et d'organisation
Chez MANNARINO, nous croyons que la passion et le désir d'apprendre sont essentiels. La diversité des idées et des expériences mène à des solutions innovantes et à la créativité. C'est pourquoi nous aimerions encourager toutes les personnes intéressées à postuler.
L’utilisation du masculin est uniquement afin d’alléger le texte. Nous souscrivons au principe d'équité en emploi. Toutes les demandes d’emploi seront traitées avec la plus stricte confidentialité.
******

companyDescription:
MANNARINO Systems & Software, Inc. is a Canadian company, based in Montreal and provides safety-critical systems, software and electronic hardware engineering services and products to the aerospace, defense, space, simulation, rail and power generation industries.

MANNARINO Systems & Software, Inc. is also an authorized Design Approval Organization (DAO) for Airborne Software (RTCA DO-178C) and Airborne Electronic Hardware (AEH) (RTCA DO-254) as established by the National Aircraft Certification Branch of Transport Canada (TCCA).

jobDescription: ABOUT USJoin us in creating a virtual livestreaming experience like no other! Our vision is to provide a virtual livestreaming experience that is more immersive, authentic, and entertaining than anything possible in physical reality. We're a game studio that is committed to an open, fun, supportive, and collaborative environment. Join us in making a difference and enjoying team activities along the way! If this opportunity sounds like a fit for you, apply now! KEY RESPONSIBILITIESClose collaboration with team members on solving core engineering challengesAbility to execute in ambiguous situations and make informed technical decisions with ownershipStrong experience with Unity engine and UI developmentCollaboration with game designers, artists, and other software developers to create user-friendly interfaces and implementing new game featuresDebugging skills for both Unity and native DLLsImplementation and optimization of game features, including physics, animations, and special effectsIntegration of models, assets, textures, and shaders into game scenesMaintaining reusable, documented codebases across multiple projectsProficient in version control (git) with understanding of merge/conflict resolutions and submodulesStay current with emerging trends and technologies in the gaming industry. NICE TO HAVESFamiliarity with technical art skills (shaders, texture and geometry coding)Nerd out over geometry optimization tricksUnderstanding of linear algebraExperience with networking /async programmingLike giving and receiving feedback WORKING WITH USIf you like the idea of working with a fast-growing team, and aspire to take leads on larger self-directed projects in the future, then this is the opportunity for you. jobDescription:
VoIP & C++ Software Engineer
We have an open spot for a professional interested in joining an amazing project that takes responsibility of the Design and implementation of end-to-end 911 Call processing!
If you are an experienced VoIP developer with strong expertise in C, C++, Asterisk, and some background with JavaScript, this is a great opportunity for you!
Candidates should have the skills and experience to quickly integrate the development team and provide design direction.
Some of your day-to-day responsibilities will be:
 Produce high-quality code in VoIP backroom environment, desktop telephony solution, and WebRTC telephony implementation using C, C++ Implement new features and maintenance in Asterisk, Kamailio, and in-house telephony libraries. Collaborate with peer software developers to design, develop, and implement industry-leading Web-based call-taking application. Participate in all phases of the software development cycle as part of a multi-functional Scrum team. Participate in the architecture of a scalable and robust software deployment model. Implement and maintain both unit tests and automated functional test coverage.
The right candidate to be part of this project will demonstrate:
 Strong C and C++ development skills in multi-threaded environments. Knowledge and experience with Asterisk PBX and related protocols including RTP and SIP. Experience building software for Linux, Windows. Experience with debugging in VoIP environment, using tools such as wireshark/tshark. Experience with distributed systems programming (protocols: TCP/IP, WebSocket). Experience contributing to code reviews. Ability to effectively work in a team.
Education Bachelor’s in computer science or Software Engineering, or equivalent work experience

jobTitle: Myopia Management Specialist - Greater Toronto Area
jobDescription:
CooperVision, a division of CooperCompanies (NYSE:COO), is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of soft contact lenses. The Company produces a full array of daily disposable, two-week and monthly contact lenses, all featuring advanced materials and optics. CooperVision has a strong heritage of solving the toughest vision challenges such as astigmatism, presbyopia and childhood myopia; and offers the most complete collection of spherical, toric and multifocal products available. Through a combination of innovative products and focused practitioner support, the company brings a refreshing perspective to the marketplace, creating real advantages for customers and wearers. For more information, visit www.coopervision.com
Job SummaryThis role is responsible for the successful implementation of the CooperVision myopia management system into ECP practices. The Myopia Management Specialist acts as the subject matter expert in myopia management working closely with field sales and professional services to maximize myopia management opportunities through education, relationship building, marketing and sales support to each targeted office.
In addition to the above duties, the Myopia Management Specialist demonstrates an expert level of customer relationship management, business development, CooperVision product and sales understanding, strategic planning and coordination between his/her accounts and CooperVision. This position requires “expert” level communication skills to partner and coach customers and sales team members. This role is brought into the customer relationship by the designated CVI account sales representative for the specific purpose of building a myopia management system, which encompasses all aspects of CooperVision’s myopia management products, that optimizes targeted patient engagement, patient education, consultation and follow up, to ensure successful treatment over the years of use, and growth of accounts myopia management practice.
Essential Functions & Accountabilities:Works in close partnership with the core CVC Canada sales reps on assigned accounts to ensure a seamless and connected experience for the customer that is best in classIs the primary and lead contact for assigned customers in their implementation of the myopia management system.Demonstrates exceptional selling skills; business acumen, presentation and communication skills, to influence customers in developing myopia management businessClear, consistent utilization and flawless execution of each component of the CVI myopia management treatment programComplete understanding of myopia management landscape, including competitors and demonstrates at expert level positioning our treatment program against the competitionExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills to best serve the customer and CooperVision interestsCustomer Interaction:Fully understands each customer’s business and completes in-depth business review with customers to best assess how to implement a myopia treatment programDevelops and leads myopia business opportunities and implements plans and solutions to gain share and Is responsible for developing specific plans of action for each assigned accountDevelops and manages myopia marketing programs with customers resulting in documented success and positive return on investmentUtilizes the full portfolio of CooperVision Value Add Services to support growth of myopia management products to gain and retain the businessIs well versed and familiar with CooperVision customer agreements and policies regarding the myopia treatment process and requirementsInterprets clinical studies and market data to add credibility, overcome objectives and influence the sales process in a compelling mannerBuilds, maintains, and leads strong relationships with other members of the sales team, sales leadership, corporate accounts team, sales support and commercial management teams to gain their support in executing customer objectives
QualificationsKnowledge, Skills and Abilities:Self-driven with an excellent ability to work independentlyUse of all Microsoft office suite of tools as well as CVI CRM solution at intermediate to advanced levelInfluences sales process at expert levelExcellent organizational skillsEnthusiastic, engaged and supportive of all CVI initiativesExceptional verbal and written communication skillsEffectively identify, evaluate and assimilate information to render quality decisionsAbility to make high‐level presentations to various sized customer groupsStrong ability to partner and coach internal sales team members and customersKnowledge of contact lens industryKnowledge and experience in optometry practice setting preferred
Work Environment90% time in the field – remote employee, home office environmentExtensive travel to cover assigned geographyLimited international travel (2 - 3 times average)
Experience5+ years eye care/health care industry experience preferred2+ years of experience in customer facing salesDemonstrated skills in customer business development, planning and plan implementation
 EducationBachelor’s degree required, or an equivalent combination of education and experienceConsideration given to candidates with strong sales experience and track record of resultsLicensed Optician preferredJob QualificationsJobSalesPrimary LocationCanada-Canada Remote-RemoteOrganizationCVI North America CommercialScheduleFull-timeUnposting DateOngoing

jobDescription:
We’re seeking a hard-working .NET Software Developer with 1 to 2 years of experience who will play a hands-on role in driving our mission to build a world-class technology company with a global footprint. You will be instrumental in playing a vital role that impacts the lives of millions of small business owners around the world and directly impact customer experiences and businesses. We are looking for people who thrive in a creative, collaborative and agile development environment.
About us
Expiration Reminder is the leading web-based platform for managing document expiration dates. Our software gives organizations the ability track, manage and send automatic email and text notifications when documents are about to expire, maintain compliance with regulations and keep vendors and customers complaint to company policies. Hundreds of organizations around the world rely on Expiration Reminder to track expiration dates. Our clients include Fortune 500 companies, small businesses, nonprofits, healthcare providers, schools, and more. And with a powerful suite of features that includes compliance rules, roadmaps, policy acknowledgement, document scanning and more that will help companies stay compliant.
Responsibilities
Translate application storyboards and use cases into functional applications.Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, reliable code to develop high throughput, performance critical, scalable applications.Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.Perform Test Driven Development (TDD) by doing peer reviews, ensuring coding standards are followed, looking for logic errors and other bugs.
Required Qualifications
1+ years of relevant working experienceSolid understanding of object-orientated or functional programming in C#.Knowledge of front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/CSS, JavaScript, XML, ES6, jQuery).Experience with SQL database design, optimization and writing queries.Working knowledge of web services including REST and MVC.Working knowledge with Git and Jira is preferred.Bachelor of Computer Science, Electrical/Software Engineering or other related degree.Bonus if you have: Cloud computing experience with Azure.Bonus if you have Xamarin and mobile development experience
Our Tech Stack
C#.NET framework (4.5 or higher)SQLWeb services, REST APIs, object-oriented design, unit testing, optimization and multithreaded programmingXamarinAzure
Location
Remote.Occasional face to face meetings.Must be an Ontario, Canada resident.
Compensation and Benefits
Medical benefits (dental, vision and drugs).Market compensation commensurate with your proven abilities.This is a full time position with a set schedule.Remote.
companyDescription:
Expiration Reminder helps small to large businesses track, manage and send automatic notifications for document expiration dates. 

Tracked documents include employee certifications and licenses, certificates of insurance, contracts, subscriptions, warranties, permits, vehicle registrations, and more.

Centralize all document expiration dates in one place, so it's easy to pull insights. Expiration Reminder feature set includes automatic notifications, reporting, employee self-service, compliance, policy acknowledgement, and more.

Add Expiration Reminder to your existing workflow using integrations like Slack, Outlook Calendar, Trello, Asana, Pipedrive, and more.

We have over 1,000 customers in over 50+ countries.

We usually have open roles, and they're all listed here! https://www.expirationreminder.net/careers

jobDescription:
Remote – East Coast Canada
Why Confluence? 
Over the past several years we have undergone a great deal of positive change and growth to become the company we are today. Our global footprint now spans multiple countries, giving our employees the opportunity to get exposure to other countries and cultures. And it stands to reason that none of this would have been possible without the hundreds of hard-working employees who work at Confluence.
What do we do?
As a leading global technology solutions provider to the investment management industry, Confluence helps clients solve complex investment data challenges across the front, middle and back office. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 1000 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.
More About The Role & Team
Due to several significant acquisitions since 2019, we are in the process of streamlining all processes and systems.
Working within our growing Transformation Technology Team this role will develop, maintain, support and integrated our internal data systems. The right candidate will develop and maintain data pipelines and models including ETL connections and in-warehouse translation tools for Business Analytics and Analysis.
This role is integral to the business, as it allows us to analyse and interpret key financial data as we grow and change.
You will be part of a small but impactful team in a growing and dynamic financial data company.
What skills and experience do I need to succeed?
You will have experience developing and maintaining Data Pipelines, including ETL connections and in-warehouse translation tools.
Cloud database/architecture experience is essential. Knime experience is highly desirable, but not essential.
You will have worked in a technical environment previously, with a leaning towards engineering business process. You will also ideally have an interest in, or aptitude for, Finance/Maths due to the type of data you will be engineering.
What do we offer?
Confluence offers generous benefit packages for team members. As a growing, global organization, we are always looking for ways to ensure that our employees can access benefits that matter to them and their families. This includes:
Generous time off packagesGlobal Career Development opportunitiesSocial Events Referral Bonus scheme- $3,000 per successful referralPlus many more!
More about the Location
We are looking to hire in the UK, Ireland, or east coast of Canada, where we have an employee base.
This is a remote position, however hybrid working will be available if you are based near one of our offices.
Values
We look for people who align with our 4 values.
Integrity
Face reality with honesty, courage and accountability
Imagination
Deal creatively with challenges and envision what the world could be
Discipline
Build good habits into reflexes which become a part of our life
Service
Committed to the success of others
If you would like to find out more about a Career at Confluence, please apply today.
We are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnic origin and we give full and fair consideration to the employment and career development of disabled persons, commensurate with their aptitudes and abilities.
To understand how and why we hold your data please view the relevant Privacy Statement:
companyDescription: Confluence is a global technology solutions provider helping the investment management industry solve complex investment data challenges. Since 1991, Confluence has been building and delivering innovative products for asset owners, asset managers and asset service providers that address a spectrum of performance and analytics, risk, data, regulatory and investor reporting needs. With the 2019 acquisition of StatPro, Confluence offers a broader range of data-driven solutions, delivering a full set of products to the front, middle and back office to reduce risk and increase efficiency. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 400 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia. For more information, visit www.confluence.com.

jobDescription:
Are you fascinated by the guillotine?Are you Ichabod Crane of the Headless CMS game?Would you brave Sleepy Hollow, as a Next.js desperado?
We're actively looking for ambitious, self-driven, front-end developers to join our team and help us push into the next-generation of web.
